Erowid name: naltrexone
Category: PHARMS
Field: MainPage

                    Text: 
                    Naltrexone



COMMON & BRAND NAMES

ReVia; Trexan; Vivitrol; Nalorex; Depade

EFFECTS CLASSIFICATION

Narcotic detoxification adjunct

CHEMICAL NAME

(5a)-17-(cyclopropylmethyl)-4,5-epoxy-3,14-dihydroxymorphinan-6-one

DESCRIPTION

Naltrexone is an opiate antagonist used in the treatment of opiate and alcohol addiction. It blocks the effects of opiates so that if a user chooses to take an opiate after taking naltrexone, they do not experience much, if any, effect. This helps improve abstinence in those who can maintain taking the daily dose of naltrexone.

BASICS

EFFECTS

IMAGES

HEALTH

LAW

DOSE

CHEMISTRY

ASK EROWID ANSWERS #

Does naloxone come in tablets, for use in case of an OD?

RESEARCH & JOURNAL ARTICLES #

Injectable extended-release naltrexone for opioid dependence [...], 2016

Obviation of opioid withdrawal syndrome by concomitant administration of naltrexone [...], 2006


                    Context: 
                    This section provides detailed information on naltrexone, including its common names, effects classification, chemical composition, and its role as an opioid antagonist in treating addiction. It highlights key aspects such as its mechanism, related research articles, and practical questions, making it essential for understanding pharmacological options within the broader drug and plant information resource.
